title: Experimental Design
text:
Experimental design is a fundamental approach in research and data analysis that enables the investigation of causal relationships between variables. This chapter introduces the key concepts and types of experimental design, including the roles of independent and dependent variables, randomization, and replication.
Learners will explore the distinction between controlled and experimental groups, the principles of A/B testing, its step-by-step implementation, and practical applications. Additionally, the chapter covers important concepts of causality versus correlation and introduces common statistical tests used to validate experimental findings.






TipSkills you will acquire in this chapter





By completing this chapter, learners will be able to:

Understand the types and principles of experimental design.
Identify independent and dependent variables in experiments.
Apply randomization and replication techniques to ensure reliable results.
Differentiate between controlled and experimental groups.
Design, implement, and analyze A/B tests.
Understand the concepts of causality and correlation.
Apply appropriate statistical tests to validate experimental outcomes.

title: Exploratory Data Analysis
text:
Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) is a fundamental step in the data science workflow, aimed at understanding the underlying structure, patterns, and relationships within a dataset. This chapter introduces key techniques for analyzing and preparing data, including handling outliers, examining pairwise and categorical variables, applying data transformations, and performing data smoothing.
Additionally, learners will explore both basic and advanced data preprocessing, with an emphasis on feature engineering to enhance the quality and predictive power of data for modeling.






TipSkills you will acquire in this chapter





-By completing this chapter, you will be able to:

Detect and handle outliers in datasets.
Analyze pairwise relationships between variables.
Explore and summarize categorical variables.
Apply data transformations and smoothing techniques to improve data quality.
Perform basic data preprocessing to clean and prepare data.
Implement advanced preprocessing techniques, including feature engineering, to optimize datasets for modeling.

title: Introduction
text:
Data Science combines a collection of methods, tools, and techniques aimed at extracting useful knowledge or reusable patterns from raw data. This process involves several key stages — acquiring, preparing, modeling, and visualizing data, followed by deploying appropriate analytical tools.
In a world where most decisions are made based on partial information and uncertain outcomes, data science helps reduce uncertainty by applying robust computational methods. It provides a systematic framework to derive precise, reliable, and quantitative insights from any set of observations.






TipSkills you will acquire in this chapter






Definition of data science.
Motivation, importance and applications of data science.
Main data science approaches , and methodologies.

title: Data Integration
text:
Data integration is a critical aspect of modern data management, involving the process of combining data from multiple sources to provide a unified view. This chapter covers the foundational concepts and techniques necessary for effective data integration.
We begin with an overview of data structures and types, data collection methods, and data storage systems, followed by an introduction to Big Data concepts. Key techniques of data integration are then explored, including duplicate detection and resolution, schema matching, semantic integration, and value alignment, illustrated with a practical ETL example.
Finally, we discuss common challenges in data integration and address important considerations regarding ethics and privacy, ensuring that data integration is both efficient and responsible.






TipSkills You Will Acquire





By completing this chapter, learners will be able to:

Understand different data structures and types and their applications.
Apply various data collection methods effectively.
Navigate data storage systems and select appropriate solutions.
Gain a foundational understanding of Big Data concepts.
Perform data integration using techniques such as:

Duplicate detection and resolution
Schema matching
Semantic integration
Value alignment

Design and implement simple ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes.
Identify and overcome common data integration challenges.
Apply ethical and privacy considerations when handling and integrating data.

title: Data Visualization
text:
Data visualization is a crucial component of data analysis, enabling the effective communication of insights through graphical representations. This chapter covers the fundamentals of data visualization, including its functions, core principles, and different approaches based on data types and visualization purposes.
Learners will also explore advanced visualization techniques, familiarize themselves with popular tools, and analyze a practical case study. An annex is provided showcasing a variety of visualization examples to inspire and guide effective visual communication.






TipSkills you will acquire in this chapter





By completing this chapter, learners will be able to:

Understand the purpose and functions of data visualization.
Apply principles of effective visualization to convey information clearly.
Select appropriate visualization methods based on data type and analysis purpose.
Utilize advanced visualization techniques to explore complex datasets.
Gain hands-on experience with popular visualization tools.
Analyze and interpret case studies to improve visualization skills.
Recognize a wide range of visualization types and their applications.
